title: A question that should be asked to each member on Riot's balance team
body:
Lord Dominik's Regards (2800g)

Stats
+40 attack damage
Passive
Unique – Last Whisper: +35% total armor penetration.

The Black Cleaver (3000g)

 Stats
+40 attack damage
+20% cooldown reduction
+400 health
Passive
Unique: Dealing physical damage to an enemy champion Cleaves them, reducing their armor by 4% for 6 seconds, stacking up to 6 times for a maximum of 24%.
Unique – Rage: Dealing physical damage grants 20 movement speed for 2 seconds. Assists on Cleaved enemy champions or kills on any unit grant 60 movement speed for 2 seconds instead. This movement speed bonus is halved for Ranged role ranged champions.


TBC is designed to be infinitely better than LDR at max stacks with the balance being that it takes a while to reach max stacks. Makes sense.


**Get each individual balance team member in a room and ask them why Graves should be able to instantly stack TBC with one auto attack**. They recently looked at Graves so they should be able to answer since they obviously decided the interaction was okay. If they can't answer, they should be fired.

This isn't even about Graves. This is about the balance team on League. Thanks,

Listen, no game ever has a perfect balance.  Even chess has problems with first turn advantage.  In a first person shooter the side of the map you're on often has advantages unless its completely symetrical and boring.  Assymetry even to the smallest degree will create imbalance, but its also an important part of creating a long lasting interesting game.

League is designed from the ground up to be assymetrical.  Picks and bans are assymetrical.  The sides of the map are flipped to be assymetrical.  And every champion in the game even if you take the same role is assymetrical.  Even champions that are arguably clones like Ashe and Varus have enough differences to where its substantial.  There should be zero expectations that the game will be 100% balanced, let alone in a week.

The thing everyone wants though is a game that _feels_ fair and balanced.  If something has like 1-2% more or less winrate and this is the case across the entire champion roster, you can have even power budgets on everyone and have a game that feels balanced.  But even that is a shot in the dark and League has only ever gotten close to it, there are always OP/UP outliers and outliers that are actually balanced but very skill dependent.

I think there should be more pressure on the balance team to make positive changes to the game, after all they do way too many -3 AD, -5 MS, -10 base damage changes that never fundamentally address problems in the game.  Those kind of nudges are fine on champions that are close to balance or are very new, but when we have champions who've been oppressive for months and we know they're busted there's no excuse for such a soft approach.  This is what's frustrating about the balance team, not the fact they don't do a perfect job.
